channel.title: welcome to emergency mode ?
channel.description: ''welcome to emergency mode'' That message show after enable shared folder , after press ctrl+d the booting continue successfuly but in emergency mode, this is bad ? that connected with apparmor , and is installed by default in ver.12 , *I have whonix ver.12 , fedora 21 host , so there is something critical when we speak for security?

item.title: welcome to emergency mode ?
item.dc:creator: anonymityISright
item.description:
Firstly i am sorry for mistake : i run whonix 11 and not 12 .

So shared folder works because i disable selinux on fedora host,
the ‘‘welcome to emergency mode’’ message show after edit fstab for automount shared folder , after press ctrl+d the booting continue successfuly but in emergency mode, this is bad ? that connected with apparmor , so there is something critical when we speak for security?
Its better to mount evry time when boot the guest the shared folder and NOT edit fstab for automount?

Read full topic

item.title: welcome to emergency mode ?
item.dc:creator: anonymityISright
item.description:
Ok , because anyway shared folder can’t work on kvm with fedora 21 host , i disable it , and now whonix boot as normaly

Read full topic
